info.name: BlueBubbles
info.description:
This is the API Documentation for the BlueBubbles Server App's REST API.

## What is BlueBubbles

BlueBubbles is a cross-platform app ecosystem aimed to bring iMessage to all your devices. This means, as long as you have a macOS device/deployment running the BlueBubbles Server App, you'll be able to send and receive iMessages.

## What does this API offer?

This API offers abilities to store backups of settings/themes, as well as interacting with the underlying macOS device. You'll be able to fetch chats, messages, attachments, handles, as well as receive notifications via sockets (Socket.IO; I want to change this in the future...)

item.name: v1
Web

request.description: Get the server's landing page (index.html)

item.description: Endpoints you should access via your web browser

item.name: MacOS

request.description: Lock your macOS device directly via the API. This endpoint can be useful if you believe your macOS device has been compromised. Locking it will prevent the adversary from accessing your account. This will not log you out, but will lock your account.

item.description:
APIs that allow you to interact with the underlying mac operating system.

**Minimum BlueBubbles Server Version**: 0.3.0

request.description: Fetch your FindMy Devices locations. If your macOS version doesn't support it, or you've never opened the FindMy app, this endpoint may *not* return `data`.
Fetch your FindMy Friends locations. If your macOS version doesn't support it, or you've never opened the FindMy app, this endpoint may *not* return `data`.
Refresh your FindMy Devices locations by using Accessibility to open the FindMy app. This endpoint returns the location data after the locations update.
Refresh your FindMy Friends locations by using Accessibility to open the FindMy app. This endpoint returns the location data after the locations update.

**Private API Only**

Change which iCloud address you send iMessages from. If you have multiple aliases for your iCloud account setup, you can choose one specifically to send messages from. By default, it's your original Apple ID.

If the alias you provide is not a vetted (approved) alias, this call will throw an error.

item.name: Server
Statistics

query.description: (Optional) A parameter telling the API which totals to calculate. Must be one of: `video`, `image`, `location` (Default: All)

request.description: Fetches different types of media totals per chat (i.e. videos & images).

query.description: (Optional) A parameter telling the API which totals to calculate. Must be one of: `video`, `image`, `location` (Default: All)
(Optional) A parameter telling the API which totals to calculate. Must be one of: `video`, `image`, `location` (Default: All)

request.description: Fetches different types of media totals for all chats (i.e. videos & images).

query.description: (Optional) A parameter telling the API which totals to calculate. Must be one of: `video`, `image`, `location` (Default: All)
(Optional) A parameter telling the API which totals to calculate. Must be one of: `handle`, `message`, `chat`, `attachment` (Default: All)

request.description: Fetches the database totals for the iMessage entities (i.e. handles, messages, chats, etc.)

query.description: (Optional) A parameter telling the API which totals to calculate. Must be one of: `handle`, `message`, `chat`, `attachment` (Default: All)

item.description: Get statistics about your iMessage database (local to your mac)

request.description: Check to see if the BlueBubbles Server App has an update available. If an update is available, the update metadata will be returned.

query.description: (Optional) Waits for the update to complete to return (default: false)

request.description:
Installs an update if one is available.

You may pass a `wait=true` URL parameter to have the endpoint wait until the update is complete to return. Otherwise, it will not by default.
Marks alerts as read based on the provided IDs
Fetch metadata about your BlueBubbles Server & Operating System

query.description: (Optional) The number of logs to fetch (starting from the most recent). Default: 100

request.description: Mark alerts as read on your BlueBubbles Server. This requires the IDs of the alerts (found by using the Get Server Alerts request) because of race cases making a "catch-all" endpoint to mark all alerts as read.

query.description: (Optional) The number of logs to fetch (starting from the most recent). Default: 100

request.description: Fetches your Server's FCM Client Configuration so you can register your device with Google Firebase.

item.description: APIs to interact with aspects of Google Firebase that are integrated into BlueBubbles

item.name: Chat

request.description:
Adds a participant to an existing chat.

Include the country code (if possible). For instance, the country code for the United States is `+1`, so include a `1` at the start of the phone number from the US.

**Minimum BlueBubbles Server Version**: 0.3.0

**Requires:** Private API

#### Request Body

``` json
{
    // The participant address to add
    "address": ""
}

```

Allows you to leave a group chat that you are in.

An error will be thrown if the chat you are trying to leave is not a group chat.

**Requires:** Private API

formdata.description: The icon to set as the group icon/photo

request.description:
Set a group chat's icon/photo.

**Requires:** Private API

Removes/Unsets a group chat's icon/photo.

**Requires:** Private API

query.description: (Optional) A comma-separated list of related items to fetch for this Chat. Must be one or more of: `lastmessage`, `participants`

query.description: (Optional) A comma-separated list of related items to fetch for this Chat. Must be one or more of: `lastmessage`, `participants`

request.description: Get the total number of chats for your iMessage account (on the device)

query.description: (Optional) What related information do you want returned with the messages? Must be one of: `attachment`, `handle`,  `sms`
(Optional) Fetches messages after a specified date, represented in seconds since EPOCH
(Optional) Fetches messages before a specified date, represented in seconds since EPOCH
(Optional) A number representing the offset for the database query. This is useful for paging through data from the database to make database calls return as quick as possible. (Default: 0)

(Optional) A number representing the limit for the database query. This is useful for paging through data from the database to make database calls return as quick as possible. (Default: 1000; Max: 1000)
(Optional) How you want to sort the returned data by date. Must be one of: `ASC`, `DESC`

request.description: Fetch messages associated with a specified chat

(Optional) A number representing the offset for the database query. This is useful for paging through data from the database to make database calls return as quick as possible. (Default: 0)

(Optional) A number representing the limit for the database query. This is useful for paging through data from the database to make database calls return as quick as possible. (Default: 1000; Max: 1000)
(Optional) How you want to sort the returned data by date. Must be one of: `ASC`, `DESC`

request.description:
Marks a chat as read. This will also dispatch an event to other BlueBubbles clients indicating the chat should be marked read.

**Minimum BlueBubbles Server Version**: 1.1.0

**Requires:** Private API

#### Request Body

N/A

Marks a chat as unread. This will also dispatch an event to other BlueBubbles clients indicating the chat should be marked unread.

If you are not running macOS Ventura and send this API request, the event will still be dispatched to other BlueBubbles clients. However, it will not be marked as unread "officially" for other iOS devices.

**Minimum BlueBubbles Server Version**: 1.4.0

**Requires:**

- Private API
- macOS Ventura
    

#### Request Body

N/A
Allows you to share your own iCloud Contact Card with another chat.

Allows you to start sending typing indicators to a chat

**Requires:** Private API

**Note:** Typing indicators will automatically stop when you send a message to the specified chat.

Allows you to stop sending typing indicators to a chat

**Requires:** Private API

**Note:** Typing indicators will automatically stop when you send a message to the specified chat.

Deletes a chat from the iMessage client on the macOS server. This will only apply to the macOS server's iMessage client, and no other Apple devices.

**Minimum BlueBubbles Server Version**: 1.3.0

**Requires:** Private API

#### Request Body

N/A

item.description: APIs for interacting with your iMessage Chats

item.name: Handle

request.description: Fetch a Handle's database information by Address (email or phone number)
Get the total number of handles for your iMessage account (on the device)

Get the handle's focus mode status.

Return values include:

- unknown
- silenced
- none

query.description: Required. The address to check if it has iMessage activated

request.description: Checks if a given address has iMessage enabled for it.

query.description: Required. The address to check if it has FaceTime activated

request.description: Checks if a given address has FaceTime enabled for it.

item.description: APIs for interacting with your iMessage Handles

item.name: Message

request.description:
Gets the messages you currently have scheduled, or have been scheduled in the past.

**Minimum BlueBubbles Server Version:** 1.4.0

Gets a single scheduled message by its' ID.

**Minimum BlueBubbles Server Version:** 1.4.0

Delets a scheduled message by its' ID

**Minimum BlueBubbles Server Version:** 1.4.0

item.name: Update a Scheduled Message by ID

request.description: Get the total number of messages for your iMessage account (on the device)
Get the total number of messages for your iMessage account (on the device)
Get the total number of messages that you have sent, for your iMessage account (on the device)

query.description: (Optional) A comma-separated list of related items to fetch for this Message. Must be one or more of: `chats`, `participants`

request.description: Fetch a Message's database information by ID
Gets a message's embedded media such as a digital touch message's `.mov` or a handwritten message

formdata.description: The GUID for the Chat you want this message to be sent to
A unique identifier for the message. This is to prevent duplicate messages from being sent.
The file name for the attachment
(Optional) Which method to use to send the attachment. Can be `apple-script` (default) or `private-api` (if enabled)

(Optional) Boolean for whether the attachment being sent is an audio message and to use the "waveform"  UI element to display it. Be careful setting this as improperly setting it may cause iMessage crashes.
(Optional) Reply to another message by GUID. Setting this will force the method to be `private-api`, so you must have the Private API setup.
(Optional) Reply to another message by GUID. Setting this will force the method to be `private-api`, so you must have the Private API setup.
(Optional) Send a subject with the message. Setting this will force the method to be `private-api`, so you must have the Private API setup.
(Optional) The part of the message to reply to. This is only used for replies. macOS Big Sur and newer. Defaults to 0. Must be an integer (min: 0)

request.description:
Send an attachment via iMessage.

**Minimum BlueBubbles Server Version**: 0.3.0

_**Note**__: the_ _`partIndex`_ _parameter is only supported on macOS BIg Sur and newer, and requires BlueBubbles Server v1.4.0_

_**Note**__: This endpoint conditionally uses the Private API if certain parameters are present. Here are the parameters that will use the Private API:_

- _method: private-api_
- _subject_
- _effectId_
- _selectedMessageGuid_

Notify for a sent message that has been silenced by the recipient's focus mode status

**Requires**:

- Private API
- macOS Monterey

item.description: APIs for interacting with your iMessage Messages

item.name: Attachment

request.description: Fetch an Attachment's database information by ID
Fetch the total number of attachments for your iMessage account (on the device)

query.description: (Optional) A parameter specifying the value to resize the width to. This aspect ratio will be maintained if a height is not present.
(Optional) A parameter specifying the value to resize the height to. This aspect ratio will be maintained if a width is not present..
(Optional) Change the quality of the image you are fetching. Must be one of: `good`, `better`, `best`
(Optional) Download the original attachment (useful for auto-converted attachments like HEIC & CAF)

request.description: Download an iMessage Attachment by ID. You may optionally specify height/width parameters to resize the image.

query.description: (Optional) A parameter specifying the value to resize the width to. This aspect ratio will be maintained if a height is not present.
(Optional) A parameter specifying the value to resize the height to. This aspect ratio will be maintained if a width is not present..
(Optional) Change the quality of the image you are fetching. Must be one of: `good`, `better`, `best`
(Optional) Download the original attachment (useful for auto-converted attachments like HEIC & CAF)

request.description:
**Private API Required**

Force download an iMessage Attachment by ID. You may optionally specify height/width parameters to resize the image.

This is different from the regular download endpoint as this will force the attachment to download if it's not already downloaded on the Mac. If an image isn't already downloaded on the Mac, and you use the regular download endpoint, you'll receive a 404 not found.

query.description: (Optional) A parameter specifying the value to resize the width to. This aspect ratio will be maintained if a height is not present.
(Optional) A parameter specifying the value to resize the height to. This aspect ratio will be maintained if a width is not present.
(Optional) Change the quality of the image you are fetching. Must be one of: `good`, `better`, `best` (Default: `good`)

request.description:
Generates a BlurHash string based on the given Attachment (by ID). You may optionally resize the image before the BlurHash is generated.

**Note**: Calculating a BlurHash is fairly intensive. Resizing the image to smaller size by specifying and/or height will reduce the time it takes to generate the hash string.

Get's an attachment's "live photo" (if available).

If an attachment is not an image or does not have a live version, this endpoint will return an error indicating that a live photo does not exist for the attachment.

formdata.description: The file attachment to upload for a multipart message

item.description: APIs for interacting with your iMessage Attachments

This is BlueBubbles first public REST API. Subsequent major changes to the API will be created under new versions.
